SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.robix.nexway
Class PodShoppingList

java.lang.Object
  com.robix.nexway.PodShoppingList
public class PodShoppingList
extends java.lang.Object

This class exists in order to efficiently select specific Pod data points and then fetch only relevant data as it changes.

General use of a PodShoppingList is as follows:

  • Create shopping list (by calling Pod.createShoppingList()).
  • Specify relevant data points. (e.g. addAllServos(), addServoProperty(), etc.)
  • Periodically call refreshXxx() methods to fetch updated data.
  • Iterate over updated data and do something with it.

The fist time the shopping list is used to query data (by calling one of the refreshXxx() or getXxxTableSize() methods), the list setup is finalized and the list can no longer be configured.

See Also:
Pod.createShoppingList(), PodEventGen

finalizeSetup

public void finalizeSetup()
Finalizes the configuration of the shopping list. After this method is called, the list cannot be configured further. Subsequent calls to addXxx() methods will throw an IllegalStateException.

It is usually not necessary to call this method explicitly. This method is called automatically upon invocation of any of the refreshXxx() or getXxxTableSize() methods.

getServoPropTableSize

public int getServoPropTableSize()
Returns the size of a table (int array) which is large enough to hold entries for all servo properties specified in the shopping list.

Returns:
the required table size
See Also:

refreshSensors(int[])

refreshServoProps

public int refreshServoProps(int[] resultTbl)
Fills a table with all relevant servo properties which have changed since the last time servo properties were refreshed for this shopping list. The table must be large enough to hold entries for all servo properties specified in the shopping list.

The returned table is in the form: 

 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |
 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |
 ...
 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |

Parameters:
resultTbl - the table to fill
Returns:
The number of ints copied to the table. A servo prop entry consists of 3 ints, i.e. if this method returns 30, then the table contains 10 servo prop entries.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if resultTbl is null
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if resultTbl is too small
See Also:
getServoPropTableSize()

refreshServoProps

public int[] refreshServoProps()
Returns a table of all relevant servo properties which have changed since the last time servo properties were refreshed for this shopping list. The returned table is in the form: 
 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |
 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |
 ...
 | servoId | servoProperty | propValue |

Returns:
the table of updated servo properties

refreshDigouts

public int refreshDigouts(int[] resultTbl)
Fills a table with all relevant digouts which have changed since the last time digouts were refreshed for this shopping list. The table must be large enough to hold entries for all sensors specified in the shopping list.

The returned table is in the form: 

 | digoutId | digoutValue |
 | digoutId | digoutValue |
 ...
 | digoutId | digoutValue |

Parameters:
resultTbl - the table to fill
Returns:
The number of ints copied to the table. A digout entry consists of 2 ints, i.e. if this method returns 10, then the table contains 5 digout entries.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if resultTbl is null
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if resultTbl is too small
See Also:
getDigoutTableSize()

refreshScriptingInfo

public ScriptingInfo refreshScriptingInfo()
Returns a ScriptingInfo object which contains the scripting info that has changed since the last time this method was called.

Returns:
the updated scripting info
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if scripting info has not been enabled for this shopping list

refreshScriptingInfo

public void refreshScriptingInfo(ScriptingInfo scriptInfo)
Fills a ScriptingInfo object with the scripting info that has changed since the last time scripting info was refreshed for this shopping list.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if scripting info has not been enabled for this shopping list
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if scriptInfo is not updatable
See Also:
ScriptingInfo.isUpdatable()
